    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Fire Giant</h1>The most militaristic of all giants, fire giants focus obsessively on learning combat techniques, mastering the arts of forging weapons and armor, and finding new ways to dominate their enemies. As a result, their social and political structures are grounded firmly in martial hierarchies, with a strict emphasis on following the orders of one’s superior, no matter if you are accountable to a lowly soldier or report to a powerful officer. As soon as a fire giant can walk, they are fitted with their first suit of forged armor. This armor is constantly remolded and replaced as the fire giant matures, both to ensure they are comfortable with steel against their skin and also to teach the giant as early as possible that they bear the burden of fighting to protect their traditions and way of life. To a fire giant, death is the flame in which the future is forged.<br /><br /> Fire giants are usually identified by their powerful stature, bright-orange hair that flickers and dances as if it were aflame, and heavy steel armor worn over garments of crimson, amber, or black. Most fire giants are covered in scars and refuse to conceal or obstruct them, as each jagged mark serves as a reminder of a valuable lesson they learned in battle. A typical fire giant stands 12 to 16 feet tall, weighs about 7,000 pounds, and lives to be 350 years old.<br /><br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Humanoid</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=14">Society</a></u>)</b>: DC 27<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=223">Fire Giant</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 10</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Giant_FireGiant.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Giant_FireGiant.png"></a><span alt="Lawful Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Lawful Evil">LE</span><span alt="Large" class="traitsize" title="Large">Large</span><span alt="Fire Trait" class="trait" title="Effects with the fire trait deal fire damage or either conjure or manipulate fire. Those that manipulate fire have no effect in an area without fire. Creatures with this trait consist primarily of fire or have a magical connection to that element."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=72">Fire</a></span><span alt="Giant Trait" class="trait" title="Giants are massive humanoid creatures."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=79">Giant</a></span><span alt="Humanoid Trait" class="trait" title="Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">Humanoid</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 172</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +18; low-light vision<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=8"><u>Jotun</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +25, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4"><u>Crafting</a></u> +22, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +23<br /><b>Str</b> +7, <b>Dex</b> +0, <b>Con</b> +5, <b>Int</b> +2, <b>Wis</b> +2, <b>Cha</b> +0<br /><b>Items</b> <a href="Armor.aspx?ID=12"><u><i>+1 half-plate</i></u></a>, <a href="Equipment.aspx?ID=45"><u>sack with 5 rocks</u></a>, <i>+1 <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Equipment.aspx?ID=280">striking</a> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Weapons.aspx?ID=24">greatsword</a></i><hr /><b>AC</b> 31, <b>Fort</b> +23, <b>Ref</b> +16, <b>Will</b> +18<br /><b>HP</b> 175; <b>Immunities</b> fire; <b>Weaknesses</b> cold 10<br /><b>Attack of Opportunity</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"><br /> <b>Catch Rock</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"><hr /><b>Speed</b> 25 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> <i>greatsword</i> +24 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=200"><u>versatile P</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d12+13 slashing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> fist +23 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d8+13 bludgeoning</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Ranged</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> rock +23 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=249"><u>brutal</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=248"><u>range increment 120 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d8+13 bludgeoning plus 1d6 fire</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Flaming Stroke</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=65"><u>evocation</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=72"><u>fire</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=134"><u>primal</a></u>) The fire giant imbues its blade with flames and makes a greatsword Strike with a –2 circumstance penalty against each creature in a 15-foot line. It makes only one attack roll and compares the result to each creature’s AC. This Strike deals an additional 1d6 fire damage and counts as one attack for the fire giant’s multiple attack penalty.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Throw Rock</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=72"><u>fire</a></u>) A rock thrown by a fire giant deals an additional 1d6 fire damage on a hit.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=53">Giant</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=224">Cloud Giant</a></td><td>11</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=223">Fire Giant</a></td><td>10</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=222">Frost Giant</a></td><td>9</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=220">Hill Giant</a></td><td>7</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=226">Rune Giant</a></td><td>16</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=457">Shadow Giant</a></td><td>13</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=221">Stone Giant</a></td><td>8</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=225">Storm Giant</a></td><td>13</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=53">Giant</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 170</i></a><br />Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They are divided into a number of subtypes.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" title="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png"> Giant Bags</h3>Giants often keep an eclectic collection of treasures in their knapsacks or bags. Among these can be found a staggeringly wide range of unexpected and odd treasures and valuables.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Locations" title="Sidebar - Locations" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_3_Locations.png"> Giant Locations</h3>As oversized as they are, giants tend to dwell in remote regions of the world, where they have the luxury of claiming larger territories of their own.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Giant Pets</h3>As with many people, giants enjoy keeping pets. Yet for giants, what constitutes a pet is often categorized as beast to others. Large animals like bears and lions, and megafauna like woolly mammoths and dinosaurs are popular, as are more magical creatures like hell hounds, manticores, griffons, and the like.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Other Giants</h3>Beyond the giants detailed here, many others dwell in remote regions of the world. Marsh giants are cultists who worship strange sea deities, shadow giants have ties to the Shadow Plane, and mountain giants are horrific butchers even other giants fear.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Advice and Rules" title="Sidebar - Advice and Rules" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_1_AdviceAndRules.png"> Oversized Themes</h3>Giants are larger-than-life foes. While many giants have themes that tie them to elemental or magical forces, the primary theme giants share is that they embody a classic cultural trope as their basis. Fire giants, for example, can be seen as oversized smiths, while hill giants should evoke the flavor of an oversized bully.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
